did.abstract: The collection is composed of cabinet cards and cartes-de-visite from commercial portrait studios in Brooklyn, N.Y. Portraits in the collection show Brooklyn and New England men, women, and children, some of whom are identified by name and address.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Dwight B. Demeritt, Jr. collection of 19th century Brooklyn portraits dates from circa 1864 to 1899 and contains 11 items. The collection is composed of cabinet cards and cartes-de-visite from commercial portrait studios in Brooklyn, N.Y. Portraits in the collection show Brooklyn and New England men, women, and children, some of whom are identified by name and address.

The following portrait studios are represented in the collection: Alva Pearsall, Gardner & Co., Manning, L.S. Batterson, William Richardson, Rawson, Bernard T. Biffar, and Jaquith's Photographic Studio

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.
